title: Iamcrypticguy
author: Iamcrypticguy
content: This year, we've witnessed projects such as $Tia, $Pyth, $tip etc., offering users substantial airdrop rewards.Those with access to information secured the free drops, while individuals like myself, who lacked  access to such insights, missed out.Naturally, a thought came to mind: What if there were a web3 exploration incentive platform that allowed users to engage with popular mainnet projects, unlock airdrop opportunities, and receive rewards within the ecosystem? This way, belonging to the community would provide easy access to airdrop information. I think something like this should be created. That is, if it's not in existence already. Your thoughts?

comments.author: libert19
comments.body: Wdym with tip? Was this airdrop significant? Anyway, all big value airdrops came unknown, the platforms you ask about already there like galx/zealy/questn etc, but none of significant value airdrop rewarded users of these sites. Airdrops are sheer luck, even people who got certain high value airdrops wouldn't be able to say confidently that this particular project gonna give airdrop in future.

Your thoughts?I think the idea of a Web3 exploration incentive platform sounds pretty awesome. It would be a game-changer for the crypto community. I'm not sure if something like this already exists, but if it doesn't, it's a concept that could bring a storm to the crypto world. And if anyone is thinking about developing such a platform, count me in as an early adopter!

comments.author: R1dwanRz
comments.body: Quote from: Iamcrypticguy on November 22, 2023, 12:24:57 PMThis year, we've witnessed projects such as $Tia, $Pyth, $tip etc., offering users substantial airdrop rewards.Those with access to information secured the free drops, while individuals like myself, who lacked  access to such insights, missed out.Naturally, a thought came to mind: What if there were a web3 exploration incentive platform that allowed users to engage with popular mainnet projects, unlock airdrop opportunities, and receive rewards within the ecosystem? This way, belonging to the community would provide easy access to airdrop information. I think something like this should be created. That is, if it's not in existence already. Your thoughts?I totally get where you're coming from tho. tbh It's a common issue for many in the web3 space. But you know, there's actually something pretty close to your idea already out there. It's called Task2Get, which is a new platform launched by Bitget Wallet.So, the cool part about Task2Get is its aim to showcase popular and potential mainnets/projects. This way, users get to participate more in airdrop interactions and potentially earn future rewards.Why I think Task2Get is interesting? because it focuses on showing off both popular and upcoming mainnet projects. This means users like us get a better shot at jumping into airdrop interactions. So currently, they've partnered up with ZetaChain for their first activity, featuring tasks across six DApps with a massive 700k ZETA reward pool. So you can now interact with those DApps and complete tasks in your own wallet app to receive rewards and it's that simple.

comments.body: You can search for information from many social media channels such as X, FB, TG, DC,... but besides that, there is also the popularity of many Web3 platforms that support marketing services in crypto space, and as far as I know there are Galxe, Zealy,... which provide a quite popular way to interact with parties.Although in recent times, some projects have rewarded the community with large sums of money, in truth, airdrops have never been a form of safety, as saturation will cause quality products to fail lows appear a lot, causing negative effects for the market. However, this is part of the job in this market, and still depends on individual research.

I didn't even see them coming.
